title: Sliders with sunflower sauce

ingredients.content: 1 brown onion (approx. 160 g), cut into quarters
20 g olive oil, plus extra for frying
40 g tomato sauce, plus extra to serve (see Tips)

preparations.content: Place sunflower seeds into mixing bowl and mill <b>25 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a small bowl and set aside.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add all remaining sauce ingredients, including reserved sunflower seeds, and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Mix <b>15 sec/speed 3<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>. Transfer into a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator until ready to use (see Tips). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place bread into mixing bowl and mill <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place onion into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add mince, dried oregano, water, tomato sauce, salt, pepper and reserved breadcrumbs and combine <b>20 sec//speed 3<b>. Form mixture into 12 patties (approx. 50 g each).

Place a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and add oil. Working in batches, fry patties for approx. 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer patties into a thermal serving bowl or onto a plate and cover to keep warm.

Slice slider buns into halves. Spread bottom half of rolls with extra tomato sauce and reserved Sunflower sauce. Top with lettuce (optional), a patty and a slice of cheese (optional). Top with remaining half of roll to serve.

hintsAndTricks: To make your own tomato sauce, please refer to the recipe in The Basic Cookbook or Everyday Cookbook.
Sunflower sauce and turkey patties can be made a day in advance. Store in the refrigerator until ready to pan fry and serve.
